text: Can the command `upload` not upload entire folders and their contents? I am getting a 'not a path to a file in the directory' error when trying to upload folders to HubSpot from my local
Essentially I am starting a new project and built out my file structure and wanted to upload all of it to HubSpot but keeps errrorrrr-ing me :angry:

<@ULAT79K6J> apologies, slight docs hiccup. In the next version (which we are about to publish) `upload` will upload folders and their child files/folders in addition to single files. For the moment, you can use `sync` rather than `upload`.
Sure thing! again, apologies for the confusion. Will update back soon when we roll out the new version, where `upload` will be replacing `sync`s functionality.
Not a problem! You solved my problem within a matter of minutes! You're the man!!

Does anyone know the specifics on where the `module_id` is being generated from for modules? I am wanting to create modules from my local env but not sure what to add into that module_id. I know for the fields.json id's we can just use any unique string but is that the same for the module_id in the meta.json file?
it's a generated ID that will be unique for your module within a portal. when creating new modules you can omit module_id and it'll be handled on our end
What about when inserting a module into a template?  Does any unique string starting with "module_" work there?

I believe thats a different scenario.
You can put any unique ID you want by _template_. At least thats how I was using it before DMv2/CMv2
So you could use more friendly names there:
`{% module "left_col_test_module" path="/modules/test-module" %}`

:wave: Happy Monday! I am happy to share that we released a new version of `@HubSpot/cms-cli` today.

*Version Update | v0.0.22*
Whatâ€™s changed?
- Consolidated uploading of files and folders into the `upload`command. The sync command is *no longer supported, use `upload` instead*.
- Added modes to support fetching and uploading drafted changes to assets (e.g. `hscms upload --portal=PROD --mode=draft project-folder project-folder`). We also added support for a `defaultMode` that can be set at the top-level of the config or for specific portals.
- Removed the `--portalId` option. The `--portal` option accepts both portal ids and config names.

Run `npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest` to update your version and get access to these new features. Be sure to let us know if you have any questions or have feedback.
To learn a bit more about modes, see <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development-reference#modes>.

The unique name can be thought of sort of like an `id` attribute from HTML. Like an `id`, the name needs to be unique across the template (including a template partials that the template depends on). The name is used as a key  when storing data for content created from the template so you also need to be careful when making changes to the name if the template is used for published content.
